alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Chesterfield, Kershaw and Lancaster. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cheraw, Pageland, Chesterfield, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Mt Pisgah, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Northeastern Technical College, Cheraw State Park, Buford, Mcbee, Jefferson, Ruby, Patrick, Mount Croghan, Bay Springs Fire Station, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, Middendorf, Alligator Fire Station, Chesterfield Detention Center and Central High School. - Streams that will be affected include Thompson Creek, Clay Creek, Collins Creek, Beaver Creek, Bear Creek, Juniper Creek and Wildcat Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain flood waters moves swiftly over roadways which can sweep away vehicles. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
